revised_title: Anatomical and Functional Analysis of the Nervous System in Caenorhabditis elegans
tldr: This study provides a detailed analysis of the structure and organization of the nervous system in Caenorhabditis elegans. The researchers reconstructed the ventral nerve cord using serial section electron micrographs and identified various types of specialized contact sites between neurons, such as chemical synapses and gap junctions. They also described the arrangement of motor neurons and interneurons, which play a crucial role in sensory integration and muscle innervation. This work contributes to our understanding of the development and function of simple nervous systems.
